meanings.definition: A person who seeks wisdom or enlightenment through intellectual inquiry and rational thought.
meanings.sent1: As a young philosophe, she spent hours reading and pondering the works of great thinkers.
meanings.sent2: The philosophe spent his days studying ancient texts and debating with his peers.
meanings.sent3: The curious philosophe decided to investigate the mysteries of the universe by observing the stars.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vast library, each book a key to unlock the secrets she sought as a philosophe.
meanings.sent5: In the realm of ideas, the philosophe was a fearless explorer, charting new territories of thought.

meanings.definition: A member of a group of French intellectuals in the 18th century who promoted Enlightenment ideas.
meanings.sent1: The salon was abuzz with discussion as each philosophe presented their latest writings.
meanings.sent2: In Paris, the philosophes gathered to debate and shape the future of society.
meanings.sent3: The philosophe walked into the cafe, ready to stir up some intellectual trouble with his radical ideas.
meanings.sent4: Among the thinkers of the Enlightenment, he stood out as a beacon of reason, a true philosophe.
meanings.sent5: The ideas of the philosophes spread like wildfire, igniting minds across Europe with the flames of knowledge.
